messages.subject: PLEASE HELP
messages.body:
Received: from 81.134.203.95 




Greetings,
How are you and the daily activities including your family? Hope everybody is
fine.
Though we've not met before,My name is Frank Ado eldest son of chief Ado i am
24yrs old,I got your contract through the Mali chambers of commence, here in
Mali, I am a citizen of Sierra Leone, elder son to the Minister of Mines and
Energy who was killed during the Sierra Leonean war by the rebels.
My father died and left behind physical cash of $12 Million USD which he safely
kept in a Security Finance Company during his regime in the office. I want to
invest this money in any profitable business in your country. I am hereby
soliciting your assistance to be my foreign partner because I've not been to
Europe/U.S or outside Africa before in my life.
So I don't want to make any costly mistake that will make me lose the money.
You will be entitled to 20% of the total sum for your assistance. All I want is
for you to receive the money and send invitation letter for me to join you.Your
urgent reply will enable me to arrange with the Security Finance Company to
move this money through their special Diplomatic Courier Services to your
country. For you to claim it till I will meet you up in your country for my
investment you are not required to pay or spend your money for anything at all.
All the necessary documents of deposit from the Security Company are with me.
In your reply, please include your telephone and fax numbers.
Thanks for your co-operation.
My best regards
Frank Ado
messages.raw:
FRANK ADO

Received: from 81.134.203.95
Date: Sun, 7 Nov 2004 14:45:16
From: "frank ado" <adofrank@uk2.net>
Subject: PLEASE HELP

Greetings,
How are you and the daily activities including your family? Hope everybody is fine.
Though we've not met before,My name is Frank Ado eldest son of chief Ado i am 24yrs old,I got your contract through the Mali chambers of commence, here in Mali, I am a citizen of Sierra Leone, elder son to the Minister of Mines and Energy who was killed during the Sierra Leonean war by the rebels.
My father died and left behind physical cash of $12 Million USD which he safely kept in a Security Finance Company during his regime in the office. I want to invest this money in any profitable business in your country. I am hereby soliciting your assistance to be my foreign partner because I've not been to Europe/U.S or outside Africa before in my life.
So I don't want to make any costly mistake that will make me lose the money. You will be entitled to 20% of the total sum for your assistance. All I want is for you to receive the money and send invitation letter for me to join you.Your urgent reply will enable me to arrange with the Security Finance Company to move this money through their special Diplomatic Courier Services to your country. For you to claim it till I will meet you up in your country for my investment you are not required to pay or spend your money for anything at all. All the necessary documents of deposit from the Security Company are with me. In your reply, please include your telephone and fax numbers.
Thanks for your co-operation.
My best regards
Frank Ado

Introducing a new player...

messages.body:
Dear Frank Ado, 

I accept your invitation! Your mail couldn't have come at a better time, and do
I ever need the money! 

What would I have to do, and when can we get started? 

I am anxious to hear from you, please write again as soon as you can. 

Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank Ado,

I accept your invitation! Your mail couldn't have come at a better time, and do I ever need the money!

What would I have to do, and when can we get started?

I am anxious to hear from you, please write again as soon as you can.

Richard Lather

messages.body:
Received: from 81.134.203.95 


Dear Richard,
How are you doing today?

Thank you very much for your response to my email and most especially your
willingness to assist me in carrying out this mutually beneficial transaction
and i want you to understand that as long as you can guarantee me of your
honesty and total co-operation,i
will provide you with the necessary documents which will aid you to receive the
funds on my behalf from the security firm where they are currently deposited.

Moreso,we will have to enter into an accord that upon receipt of the funds,you
will keep 20% of the funds for your efforts while you will assist me in
investing my portion of the funds in any lucrative business ventures in your
country.Once i am assured that i am
deling with a trustworthy individual,then i will avail you with all the
necessary details in view of actualising this venture.

Regards,
Frank
messages.raw:
FRANK ADO

Received: from 81.134.203.95
Date: Sun, 7 Nov 2004 20:24:16
From: "frank ado" <adofrank@uk2.net>

Dear Richard,

How are you doing today?

Thank you very much for your response to my email and most especially your willingness to assist me in carrying out this mutually beneficial transaction and i want you to understand that as long as you can guarantee me of your honesty and total co-operation,i
will provide you with the necessary documents which will aid you to receive the funds on my behalf from the security firm where they are currently deposited.

Moreso,we will have to enter into an accord that upon receipt of the funds,you will keep 20% of the funds for your efforts while you will assist me in investing my portion of the funds in any lucrative business ventures in your country.Once i am assured that i am
deling with a trustworthy individual,then i will avail you with all the necessary details in view of actualising this venture.

Regards,
Frank

messages.body:
Dear Frank, 

Your immediate response is very encouraging to me. I admire a man of action,
somebody who can think quickly, I have heard the phrase, "Think on your feet",
that definitely applies to you. 

Let me know what the plan is, let's get going on this. 

Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank,

Your immediate response is very encouraging to me. I admire a man of action, somebody who can think quickly, I have heard the phrase, "Think on your feet", that definitely applies to you.

Let me know what the plan is, let's get going on this.

Richard Lather

messages.body:

Dear Richard,
I have recieved your mail and i am very happy to hear from you i would like to
know a bit about yourself what you do and are you married and do you have
kids,once i have recived your next mail you have to furnish me with your
contact address and phone number and then we can proceed.
The money was deposited by my late father in a security company in europe and
since i can not travel of leave where i am right due to unforseen circumstances
thats is pulling me down that is why i need you to stand as the beneficiary of
the funds i am going to do a change of ownership and the name of depositor from
the high court here in mali to your name then you can now contact the security
company and collect the money but first before i do anything with you you have
to promise me that when you get the money out you would come for me and you
have to keep this transaction secret because of the nature of the money at sake
and myself.I know once
this money is out i would have a good life again.I would like you to promise me
that you would not let me down i need your word on this because this is my
life.
F.ADO

messages.body:
Dear Frank, 

Of course I won't let you down! I need this money as much as you need it. I
want to use my share to start my own business, I have a formula that is going
to revoluntionize the shampoo industry, and all I need is the startup money. 

To answer your questions: 

I work for a haircare products company. I've worked for these folks for 18
years, starting in the shipping department, and I've worked my way up to
manager of the shampoo development department. It was here that I perfected my
formula, and I honestly think that this will be the BIGGEST new product of the
decade. You might be interested in investing in my new company. I can guarantee
you will be very successful. 

And yes, I'm married. My wife Sally Jean and I have5 kids, Lanny 19, Annie 17,
Danny 15, Hannah 13, and our "surprise" Mortie, who is 4. Sally Jean and I
dated for 2 years in High school, and all through college, and we got married
right after we graduated in 1985. Then we had the three older kids, and thought
we were done with babies, but along came Mortie, and he is such a delight. So
smart and so handsome (if I say so myself--he looks just like me). Are you
married yet? I don't suppose so, you being only 24, but maybe you have a
girlfriend? 

Our address is 37 Yellowbrick Road, Oz, Kansas 37565 I don't think you would be
able to reach me by phone, as the lines are tied up all the time, what with the
kids on the phone or the computer all the time. 

I hope this helps you. I am looking forward to getting this business going. 

Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank,

Of course I won't let you down! I need this money as much as you need it. I want to use my share to start my own business, I have a formula that is going to revoluntionize the shampoo industry, and all I need is the startup money.

To answer your questions:

I work for a haircare products company. I've worked for these folks for 18 years, starting in the shipping department, and I've worked my way up to manager of the shampoo development department. It was here that I perfected my formula, and I honestly think that this will be the BIGGEST new product of the decade. You might be interested in investing in my new company. I can guarantee you will be very successful.

And yes, I'm married. My wife Sally Jean and I have5 kids, Lanny 19, Annie 17, Danny 15, Hannah 13, and our "surprise" Mortie, who is 4. Sally Jean and I dated for 2 years in High school, and all through college, and we got married right after we graduated in 1985. Then we had the three older kids, and thought we were done with babies, but along came Mortie, and he is such a delight. So smart and so handsome (if I say so myself--he looks just like me). Are you married yet? I don't suppose so, you being only 24, but maybe you have a girlfriend?

Our address is 37 Yellowbrick Road, Oz, Kansas 37565 I don't think you would be able to reach me by phone, as the lines are tied up all the time, what with the kids on the phone or the computer all the time.

I hope this helps you. I am looking forward to getting this business going.

Richard Lather

messages.body:
Dear Frank,

I followed your instructions, and tried to e-mail the officer in charge Igho
williams, with the address you provided

"...williams this the email (ighowilliams@europe.com).the name of the security
company ..."

and the mail couldn't be delivered. How can I write to somebody if I don't have
the information? Are you SURE this is a correct address?

Also, you didn't say if you would join me in my business venture. I think my
share of the money could "get it off the ground" but YOUR money would really
"make it fly". That way, we would be partners in all senses of the word. If you
want me to join your transaction, and I want you to join mine, we could base
our partnership on mutual trust and dependence on each other.

Does this make sense to you? 

Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank,

I followed your instructions, and tried to e-mail the officer in charge Igho williams, with the address you provided

"...williams this the email (ighowilliams@europe.com).the name of the security company ..."

and the mail couldn't be delivered. How can I write to somebody if I don't have the information? Are you SURE this is a correct address?

Also, you didn't say if you would join me in my business venture. I think my share of the money could "get it off the ground" but YOUR money would really "make it fly". That way, we would be partners in all senses of the word. If you want me to join your transaction, and I want you to join mine, we could base our partnership on mutual trust and dependence on each other.

Does this make sense to you?

Richard Lather

Well, he sends the same (sort of) note twice, 2 minutes apart...

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Williams, 

I am the beneficiary to the deposit placed in your custody by Chief Ado, who
was Minister of Mines and Energy in Sierra Leone before his death at hands of
the rebels. I am stating my intention to make claim to that deposit. 

Please let me know as soon as possible what has to be done in this matter. 

Thank you. 

Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Send this to Igho Williams, with a copy to Frank...

Dear Mr. Williams,

I am the beneficiary to the deposit placed in your custody by Chief Ado, who was Minister of Mines and Energy in Sierra Leone before his death at hands of the rebels. I am stating my intention to make claim to that deposit.

Please let me know as soon as possible what has to be done in this matter.

Thank you.

Richard Lather

messages.subject: Re: Claim
messages.body:
Received: from  




Attn:Mr Richard Lather From:Igho Williams


Dear Sir,

I am in receipt of your mail in respect of the deposit made by the late Chief
Ado and i have received directive from Mr Frank Ado to deal with you in respect
of claiming the deposit with my company.Now according to my records there are
some outstanding deposit fees that has been left unpaid due to the death of our
client(Chief Ado).He only made an upfront payment of 8months to us before his
tragic demise.This fees has to be paid before we can deliver the consignment to
you.In light of this i will want you to make available the sum of £15,360 UK
pounds to cover this deposit fees(Demur age).Upon receipt of this amount we
will now process your file and make necessary provision for delivery to you
through our diplomatic service.I will want you to get back to me so that i can
give you details of how you can make this payments to us.Thanks and I await
your urgent response.
Sincerely,
Igho Williams.
messages.raw:
IGHO WILLIAMS

Received: from [81.136.20.59]
Date: Tue, 09 Nov 2004 06:53:12
From: "igho williams" <ighowilliams@europe.com>
Subject: Re: Claim Attn:Mr Richard Lather From:Igho Williams

Dear Sir,

I am in receipt of your mail in respect of the deposit made by the late Chief Ado and i have received directive from Mr Frank Ado to deal with you in respect of claiming the deposit with my company.Now according to my records there are some outstanding deposit fees that has been left unpaid due to the death of our client(Chief Ado).He only made an upfront payment of 8months to us before his tragic demise.This fees has to be paid before we can deliver the consignment to you.In light of this i will want you to make available the sum of £15,360 UK pounds to cover this deposit fees(Demur age).Upon receipt of this amount we will now process your file and make necessary provision for delivery to you through our diplomatic service.I will want you to get back to me so that i can give you details of how you can make this payments to us.Thanks and I await your urgent response.
Sincerely,
Igho Williams.

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Igho Williams, 

When I was first contacted by Frank Ado, and invited to participate in this
matter, this was a part of his letter to me: 

"...All I want is for you to receive the money and send invitation letter for
me to join you. 

Your urgent reply will enable me to arrange with the Security Finance Company
to move this money through their special Diplomatic Courier Services to your
country.

For you to claim it till I will meet you up in your country for my investment.

You are not required to pay or spend your money for anything at all.

All the necessary documents of deposit from the Security Company are with me.

In your reply, please include your telephone and fax numbers.

Thanks for your co-operation.

My best regards
Frank Ado

Now you tell me there is an additional cost of £15,360. I don't understand. I
thought all the fees were paid by Chief Ado. I wonder why Frank Ado didn't tell
me this. I suppose I could borrow the money, but I think it would take a little
time, maybe another week or so.

Regards, Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Mr. Igho Williams,

When I was first contacted by Frank Ado, and invited to participate in this matter, this was a part of his letter to me:

"...All I want is for you to receive the money and send invitation letter for me to join you.

Your urgent reply will enable me to arrange with the Security Finance Company to move this money through their special Diplomatic Courier Services to your country.

For you to claim it till I will meet you up in your country for my investment.

You are not required to pay or spend your money for anything at all.

All the necessary documents of deposit from the Security Company are with me.

In your reply, please include your telephone and fax numbers.

Thanks for your co-operation.

My best regards
Frank Ado

Now you tell me there is an additional cost of £15,360. I don't understand. I thought all the fees were paid by Chief Ado. I wonder why Frank Ado didn't tell me this. I suppose I could borrow the money, but I think it would take a little time, maybe another week or so.

Regards, Richard Lather

A concerned note to Frank...

give you details of how you can make this payments to us.Thanks and I await
your urgent response.
Sincerely,
Igho Williams

You said in your first mail that I would not have to pay any money. What is

Rich L.

messages.body:
Received: from  


Attn:Mr R Lather from:Igho Williams

Dear Sir,

Be advice that we deal with Presidents,Ministers and many other wealthy
individuals and we pride our selves on our excellent services and
confidentiality to all our clients.Our record show that this amount is
outstanding on Chief Ado's deposit and needs to be paid before we can deliver
the consignment to you.I will think the mistake should come from Mr Frank
Ado.Although i do hope you can resolve this matter on time so that we can
expedite action on your file and have the consignment ready for delivery to you
within the next couple of days.We will be having backlogs of jobs as we
approach the end of the calender year that is why we try to be as efficient and
prompt with all claims during this period. I will wait for you to get back to
me.
Sincerely,
Igho Williams
messages.raw:
IGHO WILLIAMS

Received: from [62.249.216.218]
Date: Wed, 10 Nov 2004 05:19:49
Attn:Mr R Lather from:Igho Williams

Dear Sir,

Be advice that we deal with Presidents,Ministers and many other wealthy individuals and we pride our selves on our excellent services and confidentiality to all our clients.Our record show that this amount is outstanding on Chief Ado's deposit and needs to be paid before we can deliver the consignment to you.I will think the mistake should come from Mr Frank Ado.Although i do hope you can resolve this matter on time so that we can expedite action on your file and have the consignment ready for delivery to you within the next couple of days.We will be having backlogs of jobs as we approach the end of the calender year that is why we try to be as efficient and prompt with all claims during this period. I will wait for you to get back to me.
Sincerely,
Igho Williams

messages.body:
Dear Igho Williams, 

I do not keep nearly $29,000.00 just lying around my house. As I wrote
yesterday, I would have to borrow the money. I will have to take a 2nd mortgage
on my house. Please be patient with me. I just can't pull this kind of dough
out of the thin air, you understand. 

Richard Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Igho Williams,

I do not keep nearly $29,000.00 just lying around my house. As I wrote yesterday, I would have to borrow the money. I will have to take a 2nd mortgage on my house. Please be patient with me. I just can't pull this kind of dough out of the thin air, you understand.

Richard Lather

Shall we try to stir things up?

messages.body:
Dear Frank Ado,

I received a message from Igho Williams, where he seems to blame you for the
mistake. Why didn't you tell me that your father had neglected to pay all his
storage fees? I think he was not thinking very far into the future, and his
failure to insure that you are taken care of, speaks poorly of him, and his
business acumen.

Rich L.
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

I think he was not thinking very far into the future, and his failure to insure that you are taken care of, speaks poorly of him, and his business acumen.

Rich L.

messages.body:
Dear Frank Ado, 

Did you forget my name? I didn't forget yours, and I would never presume to
address you by any other appellation than your given name. 

When you address me as "partner" it makes me think you have forgotten my name. 

Rich
messages.raw:

Rich Lather spins a tale of mis-adventure and deliverance. Will Frank buy it? Stay tuned...

messages.body:
Dear Frank Ado, 

Sorry for not writing, I was invited on a "spur-of-the-moment" canoe-trip with
my best friends, the Davidson twins. Their names are Harlan and John. We were
in some backwoods area about 200 miles south of here, and we had quite the
adventure! We lost our canoes and nearly drowned, and were terrorized by some
pretty wierd guys, I think they wanted to kill us. We barely escaped with our
lives, and got home late last night. We were so tired, but we had to make a
report to the police about it. 

Anyway, I was telling Harley and John about the business deal you and I are
partners in, and they say they will put up the money if you will cut them in on
the deal. They also want 20%. 

So 20% for me and 20% for them will still leave you with 60%. Is this OK? Will
you agree to this? You can trust them, I've known them since we were kids. 

Rich L.

('naz-note: )
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank Ado,

Sorry for not writing, I was invited on a "spur-of-the-moment" canoe-trip with my best friends, the Davidson twins. Their names are Harlan and John. We were in some backwoods area about 200 miles south of here, and we had quite the adventure! We lost our canoes and nearly drowned, and were terrorized by some pretty wierd guys, I think they wanted to kill us. We barely escaped with our lives, and got home late last night. We were so tired, but we had to make a report to the police about it.

Anyway, I was telling Harley and John about the business deal you and I are partners in, and they say they will put up the money if you will cut them in on the deal. They also want 20%.

So 20% for me and 20% for them will still leave you with 60%. Is this OK? Will you agree to this? You can trust them, I've known them since we were kids.

Rich L.

('naz-note: This is, of course, the bare-bones plot of the movie, "Deliverance". If ya haven't seen it, go rent it, it's a dilly.)

Friday morning, I send out the challenge...

messages.body:
Dear Frank Ado, 

I talked this over with John and Harley, and they are a couple of stubborn
guys. They won't agree to your terms. They say they will put up the money if
you will give them 20% above the 20% you are going to give me. That's the last
time they will ask for 20%. 

If you offer 30% for us, their asking price for their cut will be 25%, and so
will mine.

They also said that if you refuse this, they will back away from it so fast
that your head will spin. 

The ball is in your court. Do you want to continue with this business, or shall
we just part company now? Do you want the 15,560 Euro (or $30,000 US) or not? 

Rich L.
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank Ado,

I talked this over with John and Harley, and they are a couple of stubborn guys. They won't agree to your terms. They say they will put up the money if you will give them 20% above the 20% you are going to give me. That's the last time they will ask for 20%.

If you offer 30% for us, their asking price for their cut will be 25%, and so will mine.

They also said that if you refuse this, they will back away from it so fast that your head will spin.

The ball is in your court. Do you want to continue with this business, or shall we just part company now? Do you want the 15,560 Euro (or $30,000 US) or not?

Rich L.

messages.body:
Dear Frank, 

I am so overwhelmed by your generous offer! I was so surprised by it that I
called John and Harley, and they came right over, in fact, they are standing
next to me even now! 

At first they didn't believe me when I told them that you have decided to give
us EACH 20%, they thought I was joking around, but when they read your mail, it
convinced them that you are legitimate! You should have seen them, dancing
around and clapping each other on the back! Really a sight to see. 

They're going to their bank as soon as we have a little lunch and drink some
champagne to celebrate our good luck. 

Your Igho Williams should have the money in a few hours. Tell me exactly what
to do. I've never sent money by Western Union, and neither have they. 

We'll be waiting for your reply. 

Thank you again! 

Your friend and partner, Rich L.
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank,

I am so overwhelmed by your generous offer! I was so surprised by it that I called John and Harley, and they came right over, in fact, they are standing next to me even now!

At first they didn't believe me when I told them that you have decided to give us EACH 20%, they thought I was joking around, but when they read your mail, it convinced them that you are legitimate! You should have seen them, dancing around and clapping each other on the back! Really a sight to see.

They're going to their bank as soon as we have a little lunch and drink some champagne to celebrate our good luck.

Your Igho Williams should have the money in a few hours. Tell me exactly what to do. I've never sent money by Western Union, and neither have they.

We'll be waiting for your reply.

Thank you again!

Your friend and partner, Rich L.

messages.body:
Receiver Name:

Mr, EFE ERIGA IZU. Who is this? 

London,United Kingdom. Why do I have to send the money to London? I thought the
money was in Europe.

Please make the payment in four separate installments. WHY? This is very
inconvenient. You better explain the reason for this. 

You can send two using your name and the other two using your friends names as
they are now partners in this transaction. Do I have to pretend to be them, or
should they wire some of the money themselves? 

Please make sure you forward the details of the transaction to me by email ie
control numbers,name of sender and the appropriate amount How is this done?
What are control numbers? Is there any other information we need to know?
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Never having sent money by Western Union, questions arise...

Receiver Name:
Mr, EFE ERIGA IZU. Who is this?

London,United Kingdom. Why do I have to send the money to London? I thought the money was in Europe.

Please make the payment in four separate installments. WHY? This is very inconvenient. You better explain the reason for this.

You can send two using your name and the other two using your friends names as they are now partners in this transaction. Do I have to pretend to be them, or should they wire some of the money themselves?

Please make sure you forward the details of the transaction to me by email ie control numbers,name of sender and the appropriate amount How is this done? What are control numbers? Is there any other information we need to know?

messages.body:
Received: from  


Efe Eriga Izu is our accountant and deals with all monetary matters.The funds
are here in London United Kingdom as i am sure Mr Frank Ado must be mistaken
there to categorise London as Europe having not travelled outside Africa
before.

There are specific amount you can send by western union money transfer hence it
is more sensible to send it in several transactions.It is not very important
for all of you to physically send the money it is just that i wanted to involve
them so that they will have that sense of belonging.

What to do now.

Go to western union you will be given a form to fill in the amount you want to
send,The receiver name, Sender name and destination.You will be given a receipt
that cover that transaction on this receipt all the details are contained the
control numbers.It is quite a straight forward process that takes minutes.I
trust you can take care of this and get back to me.
Sincerely,
Igho Williams.
messages.raw:
IGHO WILLIAMS

Received: from [81.129.191.198]
Date: Wed, 24 Nov 2004 13:09:31

Efe Eriga Izu is our accountant and deals with all monetary matters.The funds are here in London United Kingdom as i am sure Mr Frank Ado must be mistaken there to categorise London as Europe having not travelled outside Africa before.

There are specific amount you can send by western union money transfer hence it is more sensible to send it in several transactions.It is not very important for all of you to physically send the money it is just that i wanted to involve them so that they will have that sense of belonging.

What to do now.

Go to western union you will be given a form to fill in the amount you want to send,The receiver name, Sender name and destination.You will be given a receipt that cover that transaction on this receipt all the details are contained the control numbers.It is quite a straight forward process that takes minutes.I trust you can take care of this and get back to me.

Sincerely,
Igho Williams

messages.body:
Dear Frank, 

The reason this is so late in getting to you, I've been trying to get the
Davidson boys out of jail. They were arrested Friday afternoon, right after
going to their bank. 

Apparently, when withdrawing the money (about $30,000) from their savings
account, the bank manager Dan D. Ruff asked them what they needed the money
for? They told him the barest details of our deal, and Mr. Ruff started to
laugh. At that point, he called his secretary, Miss J. Garland, over and asked
her to provide John and Harley with some literature about Nigerian advance-fee
frauds. He called them "419-scams", and showed the boys several examples of how
these scammers work. The more he told John and Harley, the madder they got. 

John and Harley were so angry about nearly being swindled, that they started
yelling, and throwing things around the bank! Before they knew what was
happening, the secretary Miss Judy called the local police, and the Davidson
twins got carted off to jail. I had to post bail for them, and appear in court
on their behalf. 

When my wife Sally Jean heard about it, she got really upset with me for being
so gullible, but she was glad that I didn't put up any of our money. I don't
think she will ever let me forget about this episode. 

This, of course, is the end of our "deal". 

Rich Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Dear Frank,

The reason this is so late in getting to you, I've been trying to get the Davidson boys out of jail. They were arrested Friday afternoon, right after going to their bank.

Apparently, when withdrawing the money (about $30,000) from their savings account, the bank manager Dan D. Ruff asked them what they needed the money for? They told him the barest details of our deal, and Mr. Ruff started to laugh. At that point, he called his secretary, Miss J. Garland, over and asked her to provide John and Harley with some literature about Nigerian advance-fee frauds. He called them "419-scams", and showed the boys several examples of how these scammers work. The more he told John and Harley, the madder they got.

John and Harley were so angry about nearly being swindled, that they started yelling, and throwing things around the bank! Before they knew what was happening, the secretary Miss Judy called the local police, and the Davidson twins got carted off to jail. I had to post bail for them, and appear in court on their behalf.

When my wife Sally Jean heard about it, she got really upset with me for being so gullible, but she was glad that I didn't put up any of our money. I don't think she will ever let me forget about this episode.

This, of course, is the end of our "deal".

Rich Lather

messages.body:
Received: from  


Dear Mr Lather,

Your last mail was somewhat surprising though it is not unexpected as we are
aware of fraudulent individuals using vital information from government
database to defraud innocent people of their money and i will not blame you if
you choose not to go ahead with this deal but let us look at this transaction
for a minutes what if this is real and there is no fraud involved then you have
just passed up a very profitable business venture.We are a reputable
organisation with a proving track record.My suggestion in light of recent
development will be for you to come over to The United Kingdom personally to
see things for yourself that everything is real we are not scammers.Below are
me details for your confirmation.

Globalcom securities and finance.

Contact:Mr Igho williams

phone:44-793-949-7351

fax:44-871-224-8651

Address:Suite 1,temple close London.SE28 0AN

I am not a Nigerian and this deal has nothing to do with Nigeria as the funds
are here in the United Kingdom.Please i will want you have a meeting with your
friends to look at possible ways to sort out this matter as you have alot to
gain by completing this deal.Mind you it will not cost you anything to come
over here to personally collect the funds so the ball is now in your court.I
will wait to read from you before i inform Mr Frank Ado to look for another
partner to conclude this deal with.I do hope you will reconsider and please
feel free to call me should you want to talk with me regarding any area.I must
also say here that your friend are not supposed to reveal the details of our
deal with any one as i am sure you all will be in trouble if the authorities
find out that you have that kind of money in your possession.I have a good
solution to sort this out.i Await your reply.

Sincerely,

Igho.  common Nigerian name ]

Dear Mr Lather,

Thanks for your call of last night though i was not available to take your
call, i got your message.I am glad you have decided to see this deal through as
i can assure you that everything is in order.You are more than welcome to come
to London.Please start making all travel arrangements from Monday next week so
that you can be here by Wednesday 8th December.Please let me know if this date
is OK with you as we will now start to process your consignment for your
claim.Be advised that you will be required to pay all charges at the point of
delivery to you. You also need to have some identification on you showing that
you are Mr Richard Lather this is necessary for record purposes and a contact
telephone number to enable us reach at short notice.I will wait to hear from
you.Thanks
Sincerely,
Igho Williams,

messages.body:
Igho Williams, 

I did not call you, you must be very troubled by your lack of common sense. 

Do you remember that I told Frank Ado and you about the Davidson boys, who were
jailed when they became enraged when finding out about the 419 scammers? Do you
remember that I mentioned Mr. Dan D. Ruff and Miss Judy Garland of the OZ bank?
Do you think I just made that up? 

I don't know who called you, but I did not, maybe one of the Davidson boys
called you. 

If you still want to give me the money, (and perhaps cut Frank Ado OUT of the
deal) I will split it with you 60/40--60% for me and the Davidson twins, and
40% for you. I can probably convince John and Harley to put up the money for a
plane ticket for me. I checked, and can get a pretty good deal on a round-trip
fare to London for around $900. 

Let me know if this sounds good to you. 

Rich Lather
messages.raw:
RICH LATHER

Igho Williams,

I did not call you, you must be very troubled by your lack of common sense.

Do you remember that I told Frank Ado and you about the Davidson boys, who were jailed when they became enraged when finding out about the 419 scammers? Do you remember that I mentioned Mr. Dan D. Ruff and Miss Judy Garland of the OZ bank? Do you think I just made that up?

I don't know who called you, but I did not, maybe one of the Davidson boys called you.

If you still want to give me the money, (and perhaps cut Frank Ado OUT of the deal) I will split it with you 60/40--60% for me and the Davidson twins, and 40% for you. I can probably convince John and Harley to put up the money for a plane ticket for me. I checked, and can get a pretty good deal on a round-trip fare to London for around $900.

Let me know if this sounds good to you.

Rich Lather

Received: from  




Dear Mr Lather,

I beg to differ with you that i do not understand like you are making out that
i am a stupid person.I do not entertain such rudeness and language as i got a
call from someone claiming to be you. I was not there to take the call but he
left a message on my phone so you tell me if i am making things up or not.I
have the highest levels of respect and regard for you and i will expect you to
reciprocate accordingly.I do not do things like that as i have not asked for
any percentage.Howerver i am very welcome to any gratification from you as i am
acting on strict guidlines.I do not expect anything from you as i am only doing
my job.If you want to continue with this deal by comming to london fine you can
make the arrangments.Please be informed that should you choose to come over you
will be required to pay all charges at the point of delivery.I will suggest you
talk to those friends of yours to work out something.Please get back to
me.Thanks.

Sincerely

Igho Williams,
